body_html:
@andrewharp Yes, that works. I commented out that line in tensorflow/examples/android/BUILD and it builds successfully.

Is there any reason why that option fails only on arm64, and if it's not easily-fixed, is there a way to make it so that that option is only used on non-arm64 architectures? I'm building Tensorflow for arm, arm64, x86, and x64 for a project I'm working on, and it'd be nice not to have to edit between builds so I can automate the process.

Alternatively, can the option be omitted for all architectures? I'm not entirely sure what the ramifications of doing that would be.

Thanks!

body:
@andrewharp Yes, that works. I commented out that line in `tensorflow/examples/android/BUILD` and it builds successfully. 

Is there any reason why that option fails only on arm64, and if it's not easily-fixed, is there a way to make it so that that option is only used on non-arm64 architectures? I'm building Tensorflow for arm, arm64, x86, and x64 for a project I'm working on, and it'd be nice not to have to edit between builds so I can automate the process.

Alternatively, can the option be omitted for all architectures? I'm not entirely sure what the ramifications of doing that would be.

Thanks!
